meanings.definition: To suffer or die from lack of food
meanings.sent1: The poor animals in the forest may starve if they cannot find food.
meanings.sent2: During the famine, many people had to starve because there was not enough food.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater decided to starve rather than eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for music was so strong that she would rather starve than miss a single concert.
meanings.sent5: The image of the starving children haunted her dreams, urging her to help those in need.

meanings.definition: To suffer extreme hunger or deprivation
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, I felt like I could starve for a whole feast.
meanings.sent2: The stranded hiker had to starve for days before help arrived.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended to starve dramatically until their mom served dinner.
meanings.sent4: His love for adventure made him starve for new challenges every day.
meanings.sent5: The intense workout left her feeling like she could starve for a big meal.

meanings.sent1: The evil witch tried to starve the princess by locking her in a tower.
meanings.sent2: The plant will starve if you forget to water it regularly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to starve its owner by hiding the food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The lack of sunlight will starve the plant of the energy it needs to grow.
meanings.sent5: The strict diet plan aimed to starve the body of unhealthy fats and sugars.
